intro: Oxydectes althaeifolia, commonly known as the althaea leaf oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Oxydectes althaeifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
